bill_title: revise the taxation of rural electric companies with respect to receipts collected for compliance with certain environmental laws.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the taxation of rural electric companies with respect to receipts collected for compliance with certain environmental laws. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-36-5 be amended to read as follows: 10-36-5. On April fifteenth of each year, each company shall file with the secretary of revenue and regulation on forms prescribed by him the secretary a report of its gross receipts derived from furnishing electric energy during the preceding calendar year. The report shall set forth the total gross receipts, the receipts collected by the company to comply with federal and state environmental laws, rules, and regulations related to greenhouse gas emissions or global climate change, and the amount of dividends and patron's credits of the company in the state, together with the total gross receipts and the amount of dividends and patron's credits from for each county in which the company operates and shall further contain the total gross receipts and the amount of dividends and patron's credits received by the company within for each school district in each county in which the company operates. The report shall be sworn to and verified by an officer of the company. Section 2. That § 10-36-6 be amended to read as follows: 10-36-6. There is levied on each company, as of May first of each year, a tax of two percent upon the gross receipts derived by it from the furnishing of electric energy during the preceding calendar year. Gross receipts for taxation purposes may not include the receipts collected by the company to comply with federal and state environmental laws, rules, and regulations related to greenhouse gas emissions or global climate change, or dividends or distributions to patrons whether paid or credited. Each company taxed pursuant to § 10-36-6 shall receive a credit against the gross receipts tax due and payable if it has contracted jointly or severally for the use of property in this state owned, held under lease, or otherwise by a light or power company defined in § 10-35-2, a consumer power district organized pursuant to chapter 49-35, or a municipal power agency organized pursuant to chapter 9-41A if the property is assessed for taxation pursuant to chapter 10-35, subject to an excise tax as provided in § 49-37-13, or taxed as provided in § 9-41A-36. A company taxed pursuant to § 10-36-6 may deduct as a credit from the gross receipts tax to be paid, that portion of the taxes included in the payments by the company to such organizations for the use of the property described in the contract.
